result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiera S Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 6 days were granted.  Defendant to report to Huber Facility by 04/29/2016 at 5:00 p.m.  If the defendant is late, she is to serve the sentence in the Main Jail.

Defendant arrested and serving her sentence.  Email attached.
received May 2, 2016,  dated April 29, 2016 from the Office of the Sheriff, defendant did not report to the Huber Facility by 5:00 pm on 04-29-16. (reviewed by Judge Ramirez on 05-02-16)
Defendant did not report to Huber on April 29, 2016, upon apprehension defendant is to serve imposed sentence at the Waukesha County Jail.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office

Defendant Tiera S Jones in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared late.  Capias and bail forfeiture previously ordered before the defendant appeared, vacated.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Suha makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.

The Court Orders the Following:  Count 1  
Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 6 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 4/29/2016 at 5:00p.m.  If the defendant is late, she is to serve the sentence in the main jail.  Sentence Concurrent.  
Restitution: $654.01 to be paid to Roundys within 12 months, joint and several with James Baggett.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
COSTS:  $253.00
DNA Surcharge: Waived
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 4 days in Huber 

The Court Orders the Following:  Count 2
Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 6 days).  Defendant to report to Huber facility by 4/29/2016 at 5:00p.m.  If the defendant is late, she is to serve the sentence in the main jail.  Sentence Concurrent.  
COSTS:  $243.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 7/1/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 4 days in Huber
